title: Security concerns
comment: Concerns regarding the safety of the implant? How secure is the implant, may be possible for the implant to be hacked which can have major consequences where the hacker may change the function of the implant, potentially causing harm to users

title: Discrimination
comment: There may be discrimination in regards to whether or not you have the implant.  One example is in job applications where one employee may only hire those with the implant or another employee may hire those without the implant

title: Cheap to use/run
comment: The implant runs on natural body functions (electircal waves, bloodflow, temperature) and it is long lasting (around 20 year) which will reduce cost

title: Cost
comment: How much will the implant cost? Does it require a new smartphone? is their an installation fee? Will you have to pay for the implant

title: May not be the optimal treatment
comment: There may be other factors that can affect sleep such as an environmental factor where the implant may not be effective. In this case it shouldn't be thought of as a single treatment but instead supplemented alongside another treatment method.

title: Ease of burden
comment: Users will not require much effort to use the implant as an effective method to treat sleep disorders compared to other treatment methods such as therapy. It also does not seem to have the side effects of similar effort treatment such as drugs (no fear of addiction etc)

title: No long term use required
comment: The implant will deteriorate itself in a safe way if users do not want to use it anymore, meaning it does not require any long term commitment if users change their minds on whether or not they want to use it

title: Method of treatment
comment: the implant can be used as a new method to treat sleep disorders

title: Can be abused?
comment: As the sleep wake cycle is 90 minute intervals, users may set a shorter cycle in order to have more time, do other things etc. Short term effects may be minimal but in the longterm if repeatedly used, it can lead to sleep deprivation

title: Better quality of life
comment: Better sleep wake cycle will mean users will have better sleep, therefore increasing their quality of life in many aspects such as social, physical, and work related aspects of life.

title: Better productivity
comment: Users of the implant should have better sleep. As their sleep is better, they will be more alert/awake therefore in many tasks such as work, they should be more productive as their sleep is better, so they will not have negative affects of poor sleep such as tiredness/lack of concentration etc.

title: Productivity can be abused
comment: As users are likely to be more productive, this  can be abused where employees may give users of this implant greater work loads . This can lead to users becoming stressed and inturn actually affect productivity on work as work quality is likely to be worse as more work is given

title: Regulates/sleep wake cycle
comment: The implant is able to regulate a persons sleep/wake cycle
